title: Why is Aaliyah music not on iTunes? - Quora

response.answer_text: Aaliyah’s music is not only not on iTunes, it is not on any digital music service. Even CDs of her music are very hard to find. Why? Because of messy music industry crap. Her label, Blackground Records, is owned by Aaliyah’s uncle, Barry Hankerson. Blackground still exists, but apparently it doesn’t currently have a distribution deal with any of the music publishers. Hankerson owns the master recordings of all of Aaliyah’s music except her first album; that’s why it can still be found. Hankerson refuses to sell the masters or release new recordings if it. Why? Who knows? Maybe he’s hoping someone will drop a crazy amount of money in front of him. Maybe he’s so sentimental he just can’t give up his niece’s music. He isn’t saying.

Aaliyah’s Music Catalogue is not on iTunes except first Album “Age ain’t Nothin but a Number” . The rest of it is not on iTunes because the record label is defunct and the joint ventures of the other labels which the other albums came out under are in some legal bind to where it’s not available. This is so unfortunate because her estate could be still ranking in so much money. Also, I believe her mother has something to do with it. She doesn’t want anything out of her daughter , I’m not sure why but I just think of something I heard before: Her family, especially her mother is still taking the loss hard. Before Aaliyah was Aaliyah to the world, she was Aaliyah to her Family first.
